cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 335 mi S of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north today, turning northeast on Wednesday and accelerating across the southeast U.S., then forecast to exit the Mid-Atlantic coast and race northeastward into the Atlantic Friday–Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near Panama City / Florida Big Bend

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch stretches Fernandina Beach FL to South Santee River SC (southeast Atlantic coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River FL and tropical-storm warnings around that core Gulf-coast area
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, then inland across GA/SC/NC and offshore near VA–NC Outer Banks, with rain and breezy conditions extending northward into the Mid-Atlantic including Delaware Bay
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≈8%) of tropical-storm-force gusts; occasional gusts 30–40 mph possible Friday as Michael’s remnant low races offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Delaware Bay; surge heights remain below 3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Friday, producing brief urban or poor-drainage flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated short-lived tornado threat cannot be ruled out Friday, but the risk is very low for Wilmington, DE
